title: 데이터시각화
text:
Rose Diagram
ref: https://www.hankyung.com/article/202403229665i

… 다음은, 백의의 천사로 알려진 나이팅게일(Florence Nightingale, 1820–1910)이다. 그녀는 간호사로서 뿐 아니라 정보 디자이너로서 주목받을 만한 업적을 남겼다. 나이팅게일은 크림전쟁 현장에서 장병들의 위생 문제가 심각함을 깨닫고 이를 개선하기 위한 지원을 여왕에게 촉구했다. 정성스럽게 800페이지에 달하는 통계 자료를 제작해 처후 개선을 위한 설득을 시도했으나 실패했다.


이후 설득을 위해 다시 시도한 방법이 그림으로 그 자료를 압축하는 것이었다. 그녀는 중첩 막대 그래프와 원 그래프를 합한 ’폴라그래프’를 만들었다. 도표의 파란 영역이 전염병 사망자, 빨간 영역이 전투 사망자, 검정 부분이 기타 사망자인데, 이를 보면 단번에 전쟁에서 위생이 얼마나 중요한지 알 수 있다. 이 도표 덕분에 지원이 시작되었고, 42%에 달아던 사망률은 2%대로 감소하게 된다. 나이팅게일은 영국 병사들이 헛되게 죽어가는 것을 간절히 막기 원했고, 이는 전쟁에서 이기는 방법을 강렬하게 알기 원했던 여왕의 마음을 움직였다.

title: 데이터시각화
text:
John Snow
ref: https://www.erc.re.kr/webzine/vol33/sub24.jsp

… 스노는 첫 번째 줄에 나와 있는 사망자의 주소를 지도에서 찾았다. 그 주소 위에 검은 사각형을 표시했다. 이어서 두 번째 줄에 나와 있는 감염자의 주소를 찾고 검은색 사각형을 표시했다. 데이터에 나와 있는 순서대로 한 줄씩 한 줄씩 지도에 위치를 표시해 나갔다. 그중에는 한 가족으로 보이는 숫자도 있었다. 2명 이상의 사망자가 있는 주소에는 그 수만큼의 검정 사각형을 층으로 표시했다. 그 방식으로 데이터 전체를 지도에 표시했다. 스노는 사각형이 표시된 지도를 자세히 들여다보았다. 표시된 검은 사각형은 특정 지역을 중심으로 몰려 있었다. 해당 지역은 지도 중심부에 있는 ’브로드 가(Broad Street)’였고, 그 중앙에 ’공용 펌프(Pump)’가 있었다. 공용 펌프는 시내 곳곳에 있지만, 사망자가 표시된 검은 사각형은 이 펌프를 중심으로 퍼져 있었다. “그래! 바로 이거야. 이곳이 콜레라가 발생된 최초 지역이야. 이 물이 오염되었을 거야. 이 물을 길어다 마신 사람들에게 복통과 설사가 일어난 거야. 틀림없어!” 스노는 지도에 표시한 사각형과 펌프를 살펴보며 콜레라가 발생된 최초 지역이 이 곳임을 확신했다. …

title: 데이터시각화
text:
Gapminder

Gapminder Foundation: A Swedish non-profit organization.
Mission: To visualize global data on population, economy, environment, and more to make it easily understandable.
Trendalyzer Software: Initially developed by Gapminder to create the famous animated bubble graphs.

Google Acquisition: In March 2006, Google acquired Trendalyzer, recognizing its innovative approach to data visualization.
Team Integration: Gapminder’s development team officially joined Google in April 2007, further enhancing Google’s data visualization capabilities.

title: 데이터시각화
text:
The Rational Optimist
ref: Cairo (2012), Ridley (2012)
Population Issue

Claim 1: Poor countries are having too many children, leading to an increase in the world population which will reach 9 billion in 20 years.
Claim 2: Wealthy countries are having too few children, resulting in aging population problems.
Ridley’s Message: Both claims are incorrect. Birth rates in poor countries are steadily declining, while birth rates in wealthy countries are rebounding. Eventually, birth rates in all countries will converge around 2.1, stabilizing the global population.

title: 데이터시각화
text:
Engineer vs. Designer

Conflict in Data Visualization: There has been a conflict between those who emphasize functionality and prefer a logical, scientific approach and those who emphasize emotional aspects and aesthetic elements, considering themselves artists.
There exists a middle ground between the two groups, and the boundary distinguishing the two approaches is ambiguous.
Generally, those who emphasize functionality and a logical approach often come from backgrounds in statistics, cartography, and computer science.
On the other hand, those who emphasize emotional aspects and aesthetic elements typically have backgrounds in graphic design, fine arts, and journalism.

title: 데이터시각화
text:
Engineer vs. Designer

Edward Tufte (1990): Yale University Professor Emeritus of Political Statistics, Tufte is considered one of the most influential theorists in the field of information design and visualization techniques.
The highlight of Tufte’s theory: rigorous minimalism

If a graph can convey a lot of information with minimal ink, then it is a good graph.
It should provide maximum inspiration in a short time by using the least amount of ink on a small area of paper.

Data-ink ratio: the amount of ink used to present the data / the total amount of ink used to print the graphic

title: 데이터시각화
text:
Engineer vs. Designer

“Lurking behind chartjunk is contempt both for information and for the audience. Chartjunk promoters imagine that numbers and details are boring, dull, and tedious, requiring ornament to enliven. Cosmetic decoration, which frequently distorts the data, will never salvage an underlying lack of content. If the numbers are boring, then you’ve got the wrong numbers (…) Worse is contempt for our audience, designing as if readers were obtuse and uncaring. In fact, consumers of graphics are often more intelligent about the information at hand than those who fabricate the data decoration (…) The operating moral premise of information design should be that our readers are alert and caring; they may be busy, eager to get on with it, but they are not stupid.”

text:

Tufte’s Conclusion: Do not draw graphics like the ones below!

title: 데이터시각화
text:
Engineer vs. Designer
The more the medical expenses, the more the bar bends. A chart by Nigel Holmes featured in the 1979 issue of Time magazine.

title: 데이터시각화
text:
Engineer vs. Designer

If you belong to the school of people who believe that charts should only present statistics in the most straightforward, plain way, with no other visual help to the reader, for example, than the bar of the bar chart, the line of the fever graph, the circle of the pie chart, or the rules of the table, then move on to another part of the book. As long as the artist understands that the primary function is to convey statistics and respects that duty, then you can have fun (or be serious) with the image; that is, the form in which those statistics appear. (Zelterman 1986)


Humor is a great weapon in your visual arsenal. As long as it is not malicious, making people laugh with you will usually help them remember your image and therefore the point of the chart. Even a smile will encourage a reader to look into the statistics if he or she might not have thought of reading in a less-embellished chart.

title: 데이터시각화
text:
Napoleon’s Russian campaign
The greatest visualization in human history

title: 데이터시각화
text:
Napoleon’s Russian campaign
Tufte’s Comments

“It may well be the best statistical graphic ever drawn.”
“It presents six variables: the size of the army, its position on a two-dimensional plane, the direction of the army’s movement, dates during the retreat from Moscow, and temperature.”
“You could create such a drawing once in a million times, but there are no principles for making such a beautiful graphic. It represents minimalism.”

Why is it an excellent graph?

Until recently, techniques for understanding data have relied heavily on scatter plots, bar graphs, and line plots.
The drawback of these plots is their difficulty in analyzing high-dimensional data. Instead of drawing multiple plots, Minard chose to increase the number of panels in a single illustration.

title: 데이터시각화
text:
High-dimensional visualization

Fig1 – 규빈의 아이디어 (하수)Fig2 – 미나드의 아이디어

title: 데이터시각화
text:
High-dimensional visualization
Visualizing complex data beautifully like Minard:

Use multiple aesthetic elements in a single image.
We can detect various differences in hue, brightness, and form. Utilizing these as visualization tools can be very effective.

저도 배웠어요. ref: https://guebin.github.io/DV2023

Gestalt Principles
You can distinguish differences in brightness and hue.

text:
Gestalt Principles
You can distinguish not only differences in color and shade but also in size and orientation.

title: 데이터시각화
text:
Gestalt Principles
You can sense proximity.

title: 데이터시각화
text:
Gestalt Principles
An entity enclosed within a clear and distinct boundary is perceived as a single group.

title: 데이터시각화
text:
Presentations vs Explorations

It is a work called “Literary Organism.” // Tree diagram + colors.
Tree diagram: chapters, paragraphs, sentences, words.
Colors: themes frequently appearing in the novel such as travel, music, party, etc.



The exploration method allows the reader to discover messages within the illustration on their own.
For those who haven’t read the novel: this graphic provides an overview of the novel’s main themes.
For those who have already read the novel: it allows for analysis and exploration. For example, it shows instances where parties and music frequently occur together.

title: 데이터시각화
text:
Military Power of BRAZIL
|
Brazil’s national defense is ranked first in all indicators. First, they have a large number of soldiers (left chart) and seem to invest heavily in their budget (middle chart). However, it seems the population is the hidden factor (right chart).
